member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ApplicationDataAdapter
member.summary: Represents an adapter to convert between strongly typed objects and objects. The conversion is done by (de)serializing from/to the binary property.
member.remarks:
The following kinds of object types are supported:
types with defined
Runtime serializable types ( defined)
objects
.NET value types
null value
Types with WCF data contract are converted by (de)serializing with standard using binary XML format. The property will contain information about the name, namespace and version of the data contract.
Serializable types (and all value types) are converted by (de)serializing with standard . The property will contain full assembly qualified name of the serialized type.
Types representing are converted by storing UTF-8 encoded content of the XML element. The property will contain information about the name and namespace of the root element. This is the only format which potentially can be decoded in different language or technology, because the data simply contains an XML content.

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ApplicationDataAdapter.#ctor(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the adapter class from a typed application data object.
member.param: Application identifier for the application data
Typed application data object to convert - for all supported types see the class remarks

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ApplicationDataAdapter.#ctor(Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ApplicationData)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the adapter class from an object.
member.param: An object to convert

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ApplicationDataAdapter.GetAs``1
member.summary: Returns a strongly typed application data object, deserializing it from the if needed.
member.typeparam: The expected type to cast to - must be compatible with the original type
member.returns: Typed application data object of the requested type
member.remarks: Instead of explicitly creating an instance and invoking this method on it, the extension method can also be used directly on the instance.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ApplicationDataAdapter.ApplicationData
member.summary: Returns the object, serializing it from the strongly typed application data if needed.

Returns all items regardless of lock state.

and Only returns items which are permanently checked out.
and and Only returns items which are in workflow.

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ItemType
member.summary: Specifies the Content Manager item types.
member.remarks: This enumeration defines both the symbolic names and numeric values for all TCM item types. The numeric values are used in TCM URIs. Note that the numeric values look like bit flags, but they are not really: repository-local, system-wide and workflow item types have overlapping bit values. Therefore, performing bitwise ORs or ANDs is dangerous; it can only be done for item types of the same "class" (repository-local, system-wide or workflow).

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.LockType
member.summary: Defines the state (lock) of an item.
member.remarks: This is a set of flags, so combinations of the values are possible.

member.summary: Gets or sets access to the allowed Multimedia Types.
member.remarks: This property only applies to Schemas with purpose . It defines what the allowed Multimedia Types are for Multimedia Components based on this Schema.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.SchemaData.ComponentProcess
member.summary: Gets or sets an associated Process Definition which defines the editing process for Components based on this Schema..
member.remarks: If a Component Process is specified, a workflow process based on this Process Definition will be started when a Component is saved. This process has to be finished before the Component will be checked in. Hence we refer to this as an editing process.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.SchemaData.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets a description for the Schema.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.SchemaData.IsTridionWebSchema
member.summary: Gets whether the Schema qualifies as "Tridion Web Schema".
member.remarks: A "Tridion Web Schema" is a Schema for which the content model is simple enough to be represented as a set of fields.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.SchemaData.NamespaceUri
member.summary: Gets the namespace URI (target namespace) of the Schema.
member.remarks: This property is for read-only purposes and is derived from the . If this value needs to be changed, the should be updated accordingly.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.SchemaData.Purpose
member.summary: Gets or sets the purpose for the Schema.
member.remarks: A Schema can be used for a single purpose only. At the different places where Schemas can be selected, the set of available Schemas is filtered by the Schema's purpose.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.SchemaData.RootElementName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the root element.
member.remarks: In a W3C Schema (XSD), it is possible to have multiple global elements, i.e. elements that can act as root element. A Schema in Tridion Content Manager must identify a single global element as the root element.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.SchemaData.Xsd
member.summary: Gets or sets the Schema content as .

remarks.para: This property provides low-level access to the XSD. It is also possible to access the Schema content through the CoreService ReadSchemaFields API. For Tridion Web Schemas, this is possible for both the content and the metadata. For complex Schemas, this is only possible for the metadata.

For localized Schema, only the field labels can be changed. All the other changes to the schema will be ignored. The labels can be found in the following path of the Xsd : xsd:schema/xsd:annotation/xsd:appinfo/tcm:Labels

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.SchemaData.BundleProcess
member.summary: Gets or sets an associated Process Definition which defines the Bundle process.

remarks.para: If a Bundle Process is specified for Component/Multimedia Schema, Component based on this Schema must be added to a Bundle before it can be checked in. The Bundle has to be of an appropriate type. That is: The Bundle's Schema has to be associated with this Process Definition.
For Bundle Schema the Bundle Process defines the Process that will be used to start a Workflow on a Bundle based on this Schema.
This property is introduced in version 7.0

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.SchemaData.DeleteBundleOnProcessFinished
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Bundles based on this Schema should be deleted when a workflow process they are part of finishes.

remarks.para: This property is valid only for Bundle Schema. Trying to set the property on any other type of schema to anything other than false will throw an exception.
This property is introduced in version 7.0

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.SchemaData.RegionDefinition
member.summary: (Not supported in this release) Gets or sets the Region Definition.
member.remarks:
This property is valid only for Region Schema. Trying to set the property on any other type of schema to anything other than false will throw an exception.
This property is introduced in version 7.1 This property is not supported, will throw exception if used.

member.summary: Gets or sets the date/time at which the item was created.

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ApplicableActionsData
member.summary: Used to specify Applicable actions on an object.

remarks.para: The action is applicable to an item if it can potentially be executed on that item. For example, action is applicable to local item, but it is not applicable to shared item. Applicable item can be either allowed if preconditions are met or denied. For example, deleting of an local item may be denied if item is published or user does not have enough rights to manage items of that type. Note that even if action is allowed, execution of this action still may fail as not all business rule validations are performed to calculate if the action is applicable or not. Only handful subset of lightweight checks is validated here.
The dictionary contains all applicable actions (both allowed and denied). If particular action is not in this list, it is not applicable to current item.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ApplicableActionsData.Actions
member.summary: Gets the actions that are allowed to be performed on the item.
member.value: A dictionary with all actions (both TCM and custom) that are applicable to current item. The value, associated with an action shows if action is allowed or denied.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.WorkflowObjectData.ContextRepository
member.summary: Gets the context Repository: the Repository in which the object has been retrieved.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ActivityDefinitionData.Assignee
member.summary: Gets or sets the User or Group to which the Workflow activity will be assigned.

remarks.para: Depending on the character of activity this property has some limitations:

list.item: Assignee of the first activity in the process might not be set explicitly. In that case activity will be assigned to everyone.

Automatic activities (activities with property set) should be assigned to the workflow agent user (Id of this user can be found in Content Manager configuration under the 'Automatic Trustee ID' setting in the Workflow settings node).

remarks.para: If this property is not set or set to null, the value depends on the kind of activity:

list.item: For normal activity the everyone group will be assigned.
For decision activity a performer of the previous activity will be assigned.
For automatic activity (activity with property set) the workflow agent user will be assigned.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ActivityDefinitionData.Description

member.summary: Gets or sets the Workflow Process Definition that contains this activity.
member.value: Will be null if the Activity Definition is read in the context of a Process Definition. If read stand-alone it will be set.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ActivityDefinitionData.ActivityConstraints
member.summary: Gets or sets the constraints of an activity.
member.remarks: This property is introduced in version 7.0.

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.TridionActivityDefinitionData
member.summary: Represents the data of a Tridion proprietary Activity Definition.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.TridionActivityDefinitionData.ActivityType
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance represents a decision or not.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.TridionActivityDefinitionData.FinishApprovalStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets the Approval Status that is assigned to the Workflow Item when the Activity finishes.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.TridionActivityDefinitionData.NextActivityDefinitions
member.summary: Gets or sets the potential next activities in the Workflow.
member.value: Will be null if the Activity Definition is read stand-alone. In the context of a Process Definition it will be set.
member.remarks: The collection should be empty if this represents the last activity or it should contain exactly one activity, unless this represents a decision. Note that the next activity should be identified (linked) by title, not by Id.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.TridionActivityDefinitionData.Script
member.summary: Gets or sets the script of an automated Activity.
member.value: A string that contains VBScript code.

remarks.para: An Activity Definition can represent an automated activity to which a script is associated. This script is then executed by the TCM Workflow Agent once the workflow process reaches the activity.

When you create a Process Definition, you can define an automatic Activity Definition simply by setting the Script property. You don't need to explicitly specify the , it will be automatically set to the TCM Workflow Agent during the creation of the Process Definition.

The TCM Workflow Agent user is declared in the TCM configuration in the workflow section as the following example illustrates:
<configuration> <workflow workflowAgentAccountUri="tcm:0-3-65552" /> </configuration>

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.TridionActivityDefinitionData.AllowOverrideDueDate
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether can be changed manually, or not.
member.value: true if can be changed manually; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: This property is introduced in version 7.0

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.TridionActivityDefinitionData.PerformingTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout for performing current activity, in minutes.
member.value: The timeout for performing current activity, in minutes.

remarks.para: If value for this property set, default value for will be set, during creating instance of this activity definition.
This property is introduced in version 7.0

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.TridionActivityDefinitionData.ScriptType
member.summary: Gets or sets the script type of of an automated Activity.
member.value: The value must be the name of one of the configured Workflow script types.

remarks.para: This property introduced in version 7.0.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.TridionActivityDefinitionData.ExpirationScript
member.summary: Gets or sets the script for Activity Expiration.
member.value: A string that contains VBScript/CSharp code.

remarks.para: When is set, Workflow agent executes this script to expire the Activity.
This property introduced in version 7.1.

member.summary: Gets or sets the script type of of an Activity.
member.value: The value must be the name of one of the configured Workflow script types.

remarks.para: This property introduced in version 7.1.

member.value: If the Work Item is read in context of the Process, the value is null. The value is only set if the Work Item is read stand-alone.

member.summary: Gets the item participating in the workflow.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.WorkItemData.Comment
member.summary: Gets or sets a comment on the Work Item.

remarks.para: Work Item comments can be used to communicate between workflow participants. It does not have meaning for the CM system itself.
When an Activity is finished, its Work Item comments are carried over to the next Activity.
This property is introduced in version 7.0

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.WorkItemData.SubjectOwningRepository
member.summary: Gets the Owning Repository of the Subject

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ProcessData.Activities
member.summary: Gets the Activities that occurred within the Process.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ProcessData.HasSnapshots
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this Process has snapshots.
member.remarks: This property reflects the property of the Process Definition. However, if the Process Definition's property is changed, existing Processes will keep their setting.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ProcessData.Subjects
member.summary: Gets or sets the items which participate in the Process.
member.remarks: In most circumstances, this is a read-only property which represents the union of all Subjects of all Work Items of the current activity in case of process instance or last activity in case of process history. When creating a new Process Instance, this property can be set. As soon as the Process Instance is created, it will have a first Activity Instance which contains Work Items for each provided subject. If any of the subjects specified is not a workflow able item an exception is thrown.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ProcessData.Creator
member.summary: Gets the creator of this process.

remarks.para: This property is introduced in version 7.0.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ProcessData.WorkflowType
member.summary: Gets the workflow type of this process.

remarks.para: This property is introduced in version 7.0.

Different workflows are intended for different purposes (such as workflow process started automatically on editing item, project workflow where multiple items involved or task workflow process. The Workflow Type allows to distinguish workflow processes by their purpose. Predefined Workflow Types are: Unspecified (tcm:0-1-67584) (default), SystemStarted (tcm:0-2-67584) (set internally on saving of Component, Page, Component Template or Page Template if they have associated Process Definition) and Task (tcm:0-3-67584).

member.remarks: The User who starts an Activity becomes the owner of the Activity. Ownership can be transferred to someone else using the ReAssign method. Only the owner can Finish the Activity.

member.summary: Gets the Users that are performing or have performed the Activity.
member.remarks:
This property is an aggregation of the Work Items' Owner property. This property can be empty collection if the Activity was never started, and hence the Work Item(s) were never owned by anybody.
Activity can have multiple Performers because each Work Item can by owned/performed by someone else.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.RepositoryData.BusinessProcessType
member.summary: Gets or sets Business Process Type which defines the Business Process to use in this Publication.

remarks.para: The value of this property is inferred during creation from its parent publication with highest priority with non null Business Process Type. In case none of the parent publication has Business Process Type set then the value stays null.
To set this property explicitly, the Business Process Type Management and Publication Management rights are necessary.
In order to unset this property set the value of this property to Null Link (tcm:0-0-0).
This property is introduced in version 8.0

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.RepositoryData.MinimalLocalizeApprovalStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimal approval status to localize dynamic version of an item in workflow in this Publication.

remarks.para: The default value is . In this case, localization of dynamic versions is always allowed.
If set to value other than Undefined, then it is only allowed to localize dynamic version of an item in workflow if its current approval status is the same or "higher" than the specified.
This setting is only applicable to items in workflow. It is always allowed to localize dynamic versions of items that do not have associated workflow.
To set this property explicitly, the Publication Management rights are necessary.
In order to unset this property (make it Undefined) set the value of this property to Null Link (tcm:0-0-0).
This property is introduced in version 8.1.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.PublishingTargetData.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets a description of the Publishing Target.

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.TargetTypeData
member.summary: Represents the data of a Target Type used as target for publishing.
member.remarks:
When publishing in the Content Manager Explorer, the user selects Target Types. Target Types are an abstraction over Publication Targets - multiple Publication Targets can be grouped under one Target Type. The primary purpose of this is to use different Publication Targets for different Publications.
A Target Type can be used by only one Business Process Type. Target Type in use by Publication Target cannot be used by Business Process Type and vice-versa.
Creating, updating or deleting Target Type requires the user to be System Administrator. However, when Target Type is created/updated/deleted in context of a Business Process Type, the user should have Business Process Type Management rights, and in order to alter the Access Control List additional Permission Management rights is required in the context of this Business Process Type.
Deleting a Publication should delete the Target Types that are used in all the Business Process Types which are local in that Publication, not localized.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.TargetTypeData.AccessControlList
member.summary: Gets or sets the Access Control List which is used to restrict access to the Target Type.
member.remarks: Notice that saving a Target Type with empty ACL is not supported. In such case the original ACL will not be modified during saving.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.TargetTypeData.BusinessProcessType
member.summary: Gets associated Business Process Type of this Target Type.
member.remarks: When saving Target Type in context of a Business Process Type this property is automatically set. The link to the Business Proces Type is always returned in its Primary Blueprint Parent context.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.TargetTypeData.MinimalApprovalStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets MinimalApprovalStatus of this Target Type.

remarks.para: When rendering, items with approval status equal or "higher" than the minimal approval status of the Target Type will be rendered.
Items with is not affected by this setting.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.TargetTypeData.Priority

member.remarks: When creating PublishTransaction this value is used if not overridden.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.TargetTypeData.Purpose
member.summary: Gets or sets the Purpose of this Target Type in context of a Business Process Type.

remarks.para: This property can be set in context of a Business Process Type.
This value is case-sensitive.

member.remarks: A Publication Target represents one or more physical targets ("Destinations") with the same logical purpose. For example: a web farm consisting of multiple physical web servers. Publication Targets, in turn, are grouped using Target Types.

member.value: Empty string indicates that TCDL is not generated. Any non-empty string indicates that TCDL is generated - it can be the legacy name of the target language used or any name used in future.

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.WorkflowTypeData
member.summary: Represents a data of Workflow Type.

remarks.para: Different workflows are intended for different purposes (such as workflow process started automatically on editing item, project workflow where multiple items involved or task workflow process. The Workflow Type allows to distinguish workflow processes by their purpose. Predefined Workflow Types are: Unspecified (tcm:0-1-67584) (default), SystemStarted (tcm:0-2-67584) (set internally on saving of Component, Page, Component Template or Page Template if they have associated Process Definition) and Task (tcm:0-3-67584).

Workflow types are read-only and can't be created/modified/deleted through API. Custom workflow types can be registered in the Tridion.ContentManager.config in the workflowTypes section. To get the list of registered workflow types, use the ICoreService2012.GetSystemWideList with the WorkflowTypesFilterData filter.

member.value: true if permissions are specified for item itself; otherwise, false, if item inherits permissions from the parent item.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.FolderData.IsLinkedSchemaMandatory
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the linked Schema is mandatory.
member.remarks: If the linked Schema is not mandatory, it merely acts as a default Schema for new Components created in the Folder. If the linked Schema is mandatory, Components cannot be saved in the Folder unless they are based on this Schema. It is not possible to make the linked Schema mandatory if there are Components in the Folder based on another Schema.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.FolderData.LinkedSchema
member.summary: Gets or sets the linked Schema of the Folder.
member.remarks: The linked Schema acts as default Schema for Components created in the Folder. It can also acts as mandatory Schema, if is set to true. In the latter case, Components cannot be saved in the Folder unless they are based on this Schema.

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.StructureGroupData
member.summary: Represents the data of a Structure Group: an Organizational Item used to build the Publication's target structure.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.StructureGroupData.DefaultPageTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the default Page Template.
member.remarks: All items contained in the Structure Group which don't have a (default) Page Template set explicitly inherit their setting from the Structure Group. The Structure Group itself may inherit its default Page Template setting from its parent (Structure Group or Publication).

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.StructureGroupData.Directory
member.summary: Gets or sets the directory name.
member.remarks: The directory name is the Structure Group's physical name in the target structure. The directory name is subject to the restrictions of the Windows file system. The directory name of the root Structure Group may be empty.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.StructureGroupData.IsActive
member.summary: Gets or sets the active state of the Structure Group. If the active state is set to false, the Structure Group and the items inside it cannot be published.
member.remarks: Even if the active state is set to true, it is not enough for a Structure Group to be publishable; all of its ancestor Structure Groups must also have the active state set to true for that to succeed.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.StructureGroupData.IsActiveResolvedValue
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this Structure Group and its items can be published. Returns true if the active state of this Structure Group and all of its ancestors is true. Returns false if the active state of this Structure Group or any of its ancestors is false. The individual active state of each Structure Group is represented by the property .

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.StructureGroupData.IsDefaultPageTemplateInherited
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the default Page Template is inherited from the Structure Group's parent.
member.remarks: The Structure Group's parent is the containing Structure Group or the Publication in case of the root Structure Group. Returns true if the IsDefaultPageTemplateInherited property is null.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.StructureGroupData.PageProcess
member.summary: Gets or sets an associated Process Definition which defines the editing process for Pages in the Structure Group.
member.remarks: If a Page Process is specified, a workflow process based on this Process Definition will be started when a Page is saved. This process has to be finished before the Page will be checked in. Hence we refer to this as an editing process.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.StructureGroupData.PageBundleProcess
member.summary: Gets or sets an associated Process Definition which defines the Bundle process for Pages in the Structure Group.
member.remarks:
If a Page Bundle Process is specified, Pages must be added to a Bundle before they can be checked in. The Bundle has to be of an appropriate type. That is: The Bundle's Schema has to be associated with this Process Definition.
This property is introduced in version 7.0

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.CategoryData
member.summary: Represents the data of a Category of Keywords.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.CategoryData.AllowedParentCategories
member.summary: Get access to the allowed parent Categories.
member.value: A collection of Category objects. This is a connected collection: changes to the collection are reflected in the object's state.
member.remarks: Keywords from this Category are allowed to have parent Keywords from the allowed parent categories. Current implementation allows only one parent category. By default when no parent category is set the category itself is added as allowed parent category. Reassign with a new collection when changing or setting a new parent. To remove parent categories reassign with a new collection which contains the Category itself.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.CategoryData.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the description of the Category.
member.remarks: The description can be used for informational purposes.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.CategoryData.IsTaxonomyRoot
member.summary: Gets whether the Category is a root Category (i.e. it has no allowed parent Categories other than itself).

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.CategoryData.KeywordMetadataSchema
member.summary: Gets or sets the metadata Schema for the Keywords in this Category.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.CategoryData.UseForIdentification
member.summary: Gets or sets indicating whether the Category can be used for Taxonomy identification.
member.remarks: Specifies whether to enforce title uniqueness in the whole Blueprint structure on components that are classified with keywords from this Category. For example, Components can be classified by a Keyword if there is no other Component with the same title classified with this Keyword. Can be configurable only on root Categories. Title uniqueness check is performed on Component with fields that contains Keyword from Category with UseForIdentification set to true.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.CategoryData.UseForNavigation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the taxonomy in this Category can be published.
member.remarks: Before SDL Tridion 2009 the behavior was get or set whether the taxonomy can be used for navigation.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.CategoryData.XmlName
member.summary: Gets or sets the XML (type) name of the Category.
member.remarks:
Each publication contains a "Categories XSD" in which all Categories and their Keywords are defined. In this Categories XSD, each Category is represented as a complex type with this name. The XML name is subject to the restrictions specified for type names in XML Schemas:
The first character must be a letter or an underscore.
Following characters may be letters, digits, underscores, dashes or dots.

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.BusinessProcessTypeData
member.summary: Represents a Business Process Type: defines a type of (publishing) Business Process, including a set of publishing Target Types and workflows.
member.remarks:
It is a root Organizational Item. Title must be unique across its blueprint hierarchy; like all other root organizational item.
Metadata Schema, Bundle Schemas and Target Types of a Business Process Type is not localizable.
AccessControlListData and IsPermissionsInheritanceRoot cannot be set for Business Process Type.
GetList and GetListXml returns the associated .
When reading a Business Process Type the associated Target Types are returned without its Access Control List, if that information is needed, then, the Business Process Type should be loaded with LoadFlags.Expanded.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.BusinessProcessTypeData.BundleSchemas
member.summary: Gets or sets the bundle schemas which are applicable for this Business Process Type.
member.remarks:
This property is not localizable.
The collection of Bundle Schemas is used to determine the workflow that will be used in the Publication.
This property can only be set by user with Business Process Type Management rights.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.BusinessProcessTypeData.CdTopologyTypeId
member.summary: Gets or sets the topology type id of the Business Process Type.

remarks.para: This property can not be null or empty.

CdTopologyType with specified must exists in the associated Topology Manager. The endpoint address of the associated Topology Manager is stored in the environment variable with name "TRIDION_TTM_SERVICEURL".
This property is not localizable.
Value of this property is the id of the topology type from the associated Tridion Topology Manager.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.BusinessProcessTypeData.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the description of the Business Process Type.
member.remarks: The description can be used for informational purposes.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.BusinessProcessTypeData.TargetTypes
member.summary: Gets or sets associated Target Types of this Business Process Type.
member.remarks:
This property is not localizable.
The collection of Target Types is used to determine Content Delivery Environment using Topology Manager.
In order to change the Access Control List additional Permission Management rights is required in the context publication.

member.remarks: This key can be used to identify a Keyword in custom code; it has no special meaning to the TCM system. Unlike the Keyword's , this property cannot be changed in a local copy.

member.remarks: Parent Keywords are used to form a Taxonomy of Keywords. Typically, a parent Keyword is a broader term/concept. The Parent Keywords must be from one of the allowed parent Categories of this Keyword's Category.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Component Presentations on the Page.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.PageData.FileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the file name.
member.remarks: The file name is the Page's physical name in the target structure. The file name is subject to the restrictions of the Windows file system. The file name does not include the file extension. The file extension is determined by the Page Template: .

member.summary: (Not supported in this release) Gets the Region Schema for the Page's root Region.

remarks.para: Region Schema for the Page's root Region is always derived from the defined for the Page Template. This property is not supported, will throw exception if used.
If ExpandLinks specified, with fully loaded data object will be returned.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.PageData.Regions
member.summary: (Not supported in this release) Gets or sets the collection of nested Regions on the Page.
member.remarks: This is a keyed collection where keys are the region names. The collection can be modified according to the following rules. If the is set, the structure of regions must adhere to the definition specified by that schema. If the schema is not set, there is no restrictions and the regions can be added or changed in any fashion. This property is not supported, will throw exception if used.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.TemplateData.BinaryContent
member.summary: Gets or sets access to the Template's binary content.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Component Template may be used on a Page.

member.summary: Gets or sets the "dynamic" part of the Component Template: an XSLT which is executed on the Content Delivery system.
member.value: A string containing the XSLT or an empty string if not applicable.
member.remarks: Only applicable if the is set to "XML Document".

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ComponentTemplateData.IsRepositoryPublishable
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Component Template renders "dynamic" Component Presentations.
member.value: If true, the Component Template renders "dynamic" Component Presentations.
member.remarks: A "dynamic" Component Presentation is published separately instead of being embedded on a Page.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ComponentTemplateData.OutputFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the format of the rendered Component Presentation.
member.value:
The possible values are currently constrained by the system schema (cm_xml.xsd):
HTML
HTML Fragment
ASP VBScript
ASP JScript
JSP Scripting
Plain Text
XML Document
XML Fragment
ASCX WebControl
REL
Other

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ComponentTemplateData.Priority
member.summary: Gets or sets the priority used for resolving Component links.
member.remarks: The Priority is used by Content Delivery linking to resolve a Component link: if a Component is published on multiple Pages, then a choice has to be made to which Page the hyperlink should point. This decision is made based on the Priority of the Component Template used to render the Component: the hyperlink will point to the Page containing a Component Presentation with the highest priority.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ComponentTemplateData.RelatedSchemas
member.summary: Gets or sets access to the "related" Schemas.
member.remarks: If a Component Template is related to a Schema, it means that the Component Template can render Components based on that Schema. Component Template - Schema relationships are used to filter Component Templates in the GUI. When the user adds a Component Presentation to a Page, he has to select a Component and a Component Template. Once the Component is selected, the list of Component Templates is filtered: it shows only the Component Templates that are related to the Schema that the Component is based on.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ComponentTemplateData.TrackingCategories
member.summary: Gets or sets access to the "tracking" Categories.
member.remarks: When rendering a Component using the Component Template, code to increment "tracking keys" can get generated by the system. Which "tracking keys" will get incremented is determined by the Keywords attached to the Component and the Tracking Categories set on the Component Template: each Keyword attached to the Component which is part of one of the Tracking Categories will result in an associated "tracking key" increment.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ComponentTemplateData.WorkflowInfo

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.PageTemplateData.PageSchema
member.summary: (Not supported in this release) Gets or sets the page schema.
member.remarks:
Only schemas with purpose can be set on this property. When set, component presentation(s) and region(s) of page using this page template will be validated against this schema, along with its Metadata instead of the Metadata schema of the page.
If ExpandLinks specified, with fully loaded data object will be returned.
This property is not supported, will throw exception if used. This property is introduced in version 7.1.

The Bundle has to be of an appropriate type, that is, the Bundle's Schema must be associated with a Process Definition. The specified Bundle Process results in preferred Bundle types.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.AccessControlListData.AccessControlEntries
member.summary: Gets or sets the Access Control Entries which the Access Control List contains.
member.remarks: This list doesn't support delta update. So in order to add new entry, original list should be extended with that new entry, not overwritten. If AccessControlEntries are modified on organizational item which is not permissions inheritance root, changes will be silently ignored.

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.AccessControlEntryData
member.summary: Represent the data of an entry in an Access Control List, which is used to restrict access to containers.
member.remarks: An Access Control Entry specifies which permissions and/or rights a given has. Permissions and Rights can either be Allowed, Denied or Implicit Denied.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.AccessControlEntryData.AllowedPermissions
member.summary: Gets or sets the Permissions that the is allowed to have.
member.value: One or more values from the enumeration. Multiple values are combined using the bitwise or operator.
member.remarks:
This property works in conjunction with . The following combinations are possible:
AllowedAllowed bit set, Denied bit not set
Implicit DeniedAllowed bit not set, Denied bit not set
DeniedAllowed bit not set, Denied bit set

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.AccessControlEntryData.AllowedRights
member.summary: Gets or sets the Rights that the is allowed to have.
member.value: One or more values from the enumeration. Multiple values are combined using the bitwise or operator.
member.remarks:
This property works in conjunction with . The following combinations are possible:
AllowedAllowed bit set, Denied bit not set
Implicit DeniedAllowed bit not set, Denied bit not set
DeniedAllowed bit not set, Denied bit set

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.AccessControlEntryData.DeniedPermissions
member.summary: Gets or sets the Permissions that the is denied to have.
member.value: One or more values from the enumeration. Multiple values are combined using the bitwise or operator.
member.remarks:

remarks.para:
Using allows the user to:
Create, update and delete ProcessDefinitions.
Localize and UnLocalize ProcessDefinitions.
Associate Process Definition for items that supports workflow e.g. Component, Page, Page Template, Component Template and Bundle. Process Definition can be associated from Publication (for Templates), Structure Group (for Pages) or Schema (for Components and Bundles).

member.summary: Represents the data object of a ResolveInstruction.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ResolveInstructionData.ExtensionXml
member.summary: Gets or sets the XML that represents the custom properties in derived classes.
member.value: The XML representing custom properties.
member.remarks: The extension XML contains values of all custom properties added in a derived class. Each property value is stored as a separate XML element.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ResolveInstructionData.IncludeChildPublications
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to resolve items also from child publications.
member.value: true if items from child publications should also be resolved; otherwise, false. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ResolveInstructionData.IncludeComponentLinks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether component links should also be resolved.
member.remarks: If the value is true, component links in fields of components are checked and if a component holds a component link towards a component that is being resolved, that component gets resolved also, but only if it is published.
member.example: Schema S has a Component Link field. Component B is based on schema S and has a component link that links to component A. Component B is published. Component A is based on another schema that has only a text field. If we resolve component A with set to true, then the result is that both A and B will be included in the resolved items, because B holds a component link to A and B is published. However, if we resolve component B with set to false, then the result is that only B will be included in the resolved items, because there are no components having a component link towards B.
member.value: true if component links should also be resolved; otherwise, false. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ResolveInstructionData.IncludeWorkflow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the item is published from the user's work list.

remarks.para: This option is applicable only for items which are in the workflow.
If item is not in workflow, the latest checked-in version is published (but only if the work item has approval status equal or higher than the minimum value set on publication target).
If item is published from bundle, bundle conditions (such as approval status) will be validated first.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ResolveInstructionData.Purpose
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the purpose of the resolving operation.
member.remarks: For resolving operation a null value is equivalent to .

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ResolveInstructionData.StructureResolveOption
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the option to include the resolved items and/or structure.
member.value: Choose when only items should be resolved excluding the Structure. This is the default option. Choose when only the Structure should be resolved. Choose when Structure along with items should be resolved.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ResolveInstructionData.IncludeDynamicVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether dynamic version of the item will be resolved.
member.value: If true, dynamic version (if item is checked out or new) will be resolved. Otherwise, new items will not be resolved (but new items in Workflow will be resolved in case is set to true) and only checked in versions will be published. Default value is false.

remarks.para: This option is not applicable for items which are in the workflow.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.PublishInstructionData.DeployAt
member.summary: Gets or sets the date/time when the content should be deployed at the content delivery side. Set current time value to deploy immediately.
member.value: The date/time when to deploy.

member.value: The maximum number of render failures.
member.remarks: Publish Transaction will fail if the number of render failures exceeds the MaximumNumberOfRenderFailures, default = 0.

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.BinaryContentData
member.summary: Represents the binary content of a Multimedia Component or a Template.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.BinaryContentData.BinaryId
member.summary: Gets the ID of the binary in the binaries table.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.BinaryContentData.FileSize
member.summary: Gets the size of the binary data.
member.value: If the size is more than 2GB it will return -1.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.BinaryContentData.Filename
member.summary: Gets or sets the file name of the binary content.
member.value: If the binary content is stored externally, the value reflects the logical file name of the binary data (determined by the CM system). If the binary content is stored internally, the value should be set to the original file name (not the full path).
member.remarks: For backward compatibility purposes, it is allowed to set this property to the external binary URI. This will effectively set the property instead. When reading this property through an Core Service endpoint older than 2012, it will still reflect the external binary URI, but on a 2012 or later version endpoint, it will not contain the URI, but the logical file name of the binary data.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.BinaryContentData.IsExternal
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the binary content is stored internally or externally.
member.remarks: If the binary content is stored externally, the property should contain the URL where the binary content can be retrieved.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.BinaryContentData.MultimediaType
member.summary: Gets or sets the Multimedia Type of the binary content.
member.remarks: This only applies to the binary content of Multimedia Components; for templates with binary content, this property is always null.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.BinaryContentData.UploadFromFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the uploaded filename of the binary content.
member.remarks: If the binary content is stored externally, should not have value. If the binary content is stored internally, should contain filepath.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.BinaryContentData.MimeType
member.summary: Gets a value indicating the MimeType of the binary content.
member.remarks: Getting the MimeType from the MultiMediaType property requires an extra call. For getting the XML list of RepositoryLocalObjects the MimeType is needed. This property is only set when requesting a list using and the property is set. Supported CoreService Endpoint : CoreService 2011

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.BinaryContentData.ExternalBinaryUri
member.summary: Gets or sets the URI for external binary content.
member.value: This property should only be set if is true.
member.remarks: This property is introduced in version 7.0.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.BinaryContentData.Size
member.summary: Gets the size of the binary data.
member.remarks: This property is introduced in version 7.0.

If the is set, the structure of regions must adhere to the definition specified by that schema. member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum number of Component Presentation(s) in the Region.
member.remarks: The minimum occurrence specifies the minimum number of Component Presentation(s) that the Region must have. Typical occurrence values are 0 (optional field) and 1 (required field). Default Value is 0.

member.summary: Gets or sets the processDefinition for creating process instance.
member.remarks: This property cannot be modified using event system by subscribing to StartWorkflowEventArgs.

member.summary: Gets or sets the initial value for title of Process instance.

member.summary: Gets or sets the items which participate in the Process.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.StartWorkflowInstructionData.WorkflowType
member.summary: Gets or sets the workflow type of the Process.

remarks.para: Different workflows are intended for different purposes (such as workflow process started automatically on editing item, project workflow where multiple items involved or task workflow process. The Workflow Type allows to distinguish workflow processes by their purpose. Predefined Workflow Types are: Unspecified (tcm:0-1-67584) (default), SystemStarted (tcm:0-2-67584) (set internally on saving of Component, Page, Component Template or Page Template if they have associated Process Definition) and Task (tcm:0-3-67584).

If property is not set and process is being created using Repository.TaskProcess process definition, the Task (tcm:0-3-67584) workflow type will be set; otherwise, Unspecified (tcm:0-1-67584) will be used.

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.QueueMessagePriority
member.summary: Defines possible priorities that a queue message can have.

remarks.para: Using , this message is retrieved if there aren't any messages with or priority in the queue.
Using , this message is retrieved if there aren't any messages with priority.
Using , this message is retrieved before the messages with or priority in the queue.

member.summary: Represents the set of content/metadata field definitions in a Schema.
member.remarks:
Two subsets of fields are distinguished: and . It depends on the which of these subsets are present:
Both subsets are present, unless the content is complex (in which case only the MetadataFields subset is present).
Only the MetadataFields subset is present.
Only the MetadataFields subset is present.
Only the Fields subset is present.
Only the Fields subset is present.
Only the Fields subset is present.
Only the Fields subset is present.
Only the MetadataFields subset is present.
Only the MetadataFields subset is present.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum occurrence of the field.
member.remarks: The maximum occurrence specifies the maximum number of values that field may have. Typical occurrence values are 1 (single valued field) and -1 (multi valued field).

member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum occurrence of the field.
member.remarks: The minimum occurrence specifies the minimum number of values that the field must have. Typical occurrence values are 0 (optional field) and 1 (required field).

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ItemFieldDefinitionData.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the XML name of the field.
member.remarks: A field's values are contained in XML elements with this name as (local) name.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ItemFieldDefinitionData.ExtensionXml
member.summary: Gets or sets the extension XML element which can contain any custom data.
member.value: The extension XML element (the root element name is (must be) always tcm:ExtensionXml).
member.remarks: This property is new in the 2011 SP1 version. The recommended way of storing the extension data is to create an element inside the tcm:ExtensionXml element and then store all the specific information below that element. To access the extension data, first try to select the application's parent element - if it doesn't exist, create one by adding a child element to the ExtensionXml root element. The content of this property is shared between all add-on applications, so every application must take that into account and do not accidentally delete or overwrite information not belonging to it. Supported CoreService Endpoint : CoreService 2011

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ResolveContainingPagesInstructionData
member.summary: An instruction data that configures containing pages resolving.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ResolveContainingPagesInstructionData.IncludeComponentMetadataLinks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether component links in component's metadata will be taken into account during resolving.

remarks.para: The default value is false.
This setting is applied to intermediate components that contain links (direct or indirect) to provided component in metadata.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ResolveContainingPagesInstructionData.IncludeDynamicVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to resolve dynamic version for items that are not in workflow.
member.value: If true, dynamic version (if item is checked out or new) will be taken into account during resolving. Otherwise, dynamic versions will not be taken into account (but dynamic versions of items in Workflow will be used in resolving in case is set to true).

remarks.para: The default value is false.
This setting is applied to pages, page templates and intermediate components that contain links (direct or indirect) to provided component that are not in workflow.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ResolveContainingPagesInstructionData.IncludePageMetadataLinks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether component links in page's metadata will be taken into account during resolving.

remarks.para: The default value is false.
This setting is applied to pages that contain links (direct or indirect) to provided component in metadata.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ResolveContainingPagesInstructionData.IncludeWorkflow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to include current versions of items in workflow.
member.value: If true, the current dynamic version of an item in workflow (regardless of the value of ) is taken into account during resolving. If false, changes made in running workflow is not considered and the latest checked in version is used for resolving.

remarks.para: The default value is false.
This setting is applied to pages, page templates and intermediate components that contain links (direct or indirect) to provided component that are in workflow.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ResolveContainingPagesInstructionData.ResolvePublishedPagesOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to resolve only published pages.
member.value: If set to true, only published pages will be resolved. If not set or set to false, all pages will be resolved.

remarks.para: The default value is false.
This setting is only applied to pages.

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ContainingPagesDictionary
member.summary: Set of pages where component is directly or indirectly used as well as publish info of these pages. If page is not published, publish info list will be empty.

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.DeleteTaxonomyNodeMode
member.summary: Specifies what will happen to the child nodes of a Taxonomy node after that node's deletion.

remarks.para: Using , nodes in child Publications that are part of the branch will not be deleted. If a child node has other parents that are not part of the branch, the child node and its children will not be deleted. .
Using , if a child node has other parents that are not part of the branch, the child node and its children will not be deleted. .

member.name: F:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.DeleteTaxonomyNodeMode.DeleteBranch
member.summary: Specifies that the entire branch of descendant nodes will be deleted, excluding nodes in child Publications.

member.name: F:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.DeleteTaxonomyNodeMode.DeleteBranchIncludeChildPublications
member.summary: Specifies that the entire branch of descendants will be deleted, including nodes in child Publications.

member.name: F:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.DeleteTaxonomyNodeMode.RemoveParentFromChildren
member.summary: Specifies that the deleted node will be removed from the children's parents. Children will become root if they have no other parents. If the children have other parents, those parents are preserved.

member.name: F:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.DeleteTaxonomyNodeMode.AssignChildrenToGrandparents
member.summary: Specifies that the parents of the deleted node adopt the deleted node's children. If the children have other parents, those parents are preserved.

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.OperationInstruction
member.summary: Optional instructions that control how operation will be executed.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.OperationInstruction.Mode
member.summary: Controls how to react on validation errors and warnings.

remarks.para: In mode operation will be stopped before doing actual changes in DB if any error will be found.
In mode operation will be stopped before doing actual changes in DB if any error or warning will be found.
Note that in case of preliminary stopping of the operation, processed event handlers are not executed.

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.OperationMode
member.summary: Specifies type of behavior when validation errors occur.

member.name: F:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.OperationMode.FailOnError
member.summary: Fails the operation in case of any validation error found (warnings are returned in the operation result, but do not break operation).

member.name: F:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.OperationMode.FailOnWarning
member.summary: Fails the operation in case of any validation error or warning found.

member.summary: Gets or sets a condition on the InRepository property. When null is specified the condition is not applied
member.remarks: When specified, the results are constrained by the specified value in the filter. For example, if the value is set to a of a Repository, only items in that Repository will be included in the result. When using the CoreService, the type might be generated as by the proxy generator.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.WhereUsedFilterData.ItemTypes

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.UsingItemsFilterData
member.summary: Represents the data of a Filter for list of items using specific item.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.UsingItemsFilterData.ExcludeTaxonomyRelations
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether taxonomy relations are excluded from the result.
member.value: The default value is false.
member.remarks:
When specified, the results are constrained by the specified value in the filter. For example, if the value is set to true, all Taxonomy relations will be excluded from the result.
Taxonomy relations are parent, child and related Keywords of a and allowed parent Categories of a .

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.UsingItemsFilterData.IncludeLocalCopies
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether local copies are included.
member.remarks:
The default value is false.
When specified, the results are constrained by the specified value in the filter. For example, if the value is set to true, items that are local copies will be included in the result.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.UsingItemsFilterData.IncludeVersionsColumn
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the item's version is included in the returned list.
member.value: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.UsingItemsFilterData.IncludedVersions
member.summary: Gets or sets a condition that specifies which versions to include in the result.
member.value: The default value is VersionCondition.AllVersions.

remarks.para: The results are constrained by the specified value in the filter. For example, if the value is set to VersionCondition.OnlyLatestVersions, only the items' latests version will be included in the result.

example.code: UsingItemsFilterData filter = new UsingItemsFilterData(); filter.IncludedVersions = VersionCondition.AllVersions | VersionCondition.OnlyLatestVersions

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.UsedItemsFilterData.IncludeBlueprintParentItem

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to include dynamic version of an item.

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.OrganizationalItemItemsFilterData
member.summary: Represents the data class of a Filter for a list of items in Organizational Item. There is a legacy issue related to the fact that , and conditions map together to the same, one legacy filter condition called SubType. This means if any of those conditions is set and later read as one of the others, you may get a value which is out of range of the enumeration. However, this is not normal use case.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.OrganizationalItemItemsFilterData.BasedOnSchemas
member.summary: Gets or sets a condition to return only items that are using the given schemas.
member.remarks: If the list of schemas is null, the condition is not applied. This condition should be used in conjunction with . Setting the condition to an empty list of schemas will return an empty list.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.OrganizationalItemItemsFilterData.NotBasedOnSchema
member.summary: Gets or sets a condition to limit the returned list to only include components that are not based on the specified schema..
member.value: When null is specified, the condition is not applied.
member.remarks: Used internally to assert if the folder with mandatory linked schema has components based on other schema. When specified, the only components based on OTHER schema's will be included in the result.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.OrganizationalItemItemsFilterData.ShowNewItems
member.summary: Gets or sets a condition on the whether the show new items in the list.
member.value: If null, the constraint is not applied.
member.remarks: Specifies whether to include new items (items that have not been checked-in yet). By default newly created items are not included in the result list.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.OrganizationalItemItemsFilterData.TemplateTypeIds
member.summary: Gets or sets the condition to limit the list to items with given template type IDs.
member.value: A collection of template types IDs or null if the condition is not specified.
member.remarks: Setting this value sets the ComponentTypes to null.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.OrganizationalItemItemsFilterData.FailIfNoAccessToItems
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the operation should fail if there are items in the list to which the user does not have access.
member.remarks:
Setting this property to true will result in exceptions if the user does not have access to the items returned by the operation or to the subject of the operation.
This property is introduced in version 7.0

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.OrganizationalItemItemsFilterData.IncludePathColumn
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to include the Path in the list.
member.value: true to include Path column; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets or sets a condition on the IsAbstract property. When null is specified, the condition is not applied.
member.value: When specified, the results are constraint by the specified value in the filter. For example, if the value is set to true, only the abstract keywords will be included in the result. If the value is set to false, only non-abstract keywords will be included in the result. If the value is not set, both abstract and non-abstract keywords will be included in the result.

member.summary: Gets or sets a condition on the IsRoot property. When null is specified, the condition is not applied.

If the value is set to false, only non-root keywords will be included in the result. If the value is not set, both root and non-root keywords will be included in the result.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value limiting the number of items returned in the list.
member.value: Positive value or null if the condition is not specified.
member.remarks: Setting the value to zero will return an empty list.

For example, if the value is set to a , only items in that Category will be included in the result. This condition maps to the FromCategory condition in the FilterData.Conditions collection.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ChildKeywordsFilterData.IsAbstract
member.summary: Gets or sets a condition on the IsAbstract property.

If the value is set to false, only the concrete keywords will be included in the result. If the value is null, both abstract and concrete keywords will be included. member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.GroupMembersFilterData.Recursive
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to include trustees from child groups (recursively).

remarks.para: Default value is false. In this case only direct members of the group will be returned. The and of the group members will be loaded.

If set to true, following items will be returned:
Subject group.
Nested groups sorted by nesting level (direct members first, groups that are members of direct members, etc.) Secondary sorting (of groups on one level) will be alphabetical.
Users from all groups, sorted alphabetically.
If set to true then and will not be loaded.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether bundles from any publication will be returned or only those where current BluePrint variant of an item exists.

When the property OnlySpecifiedBluePrintVariant is set to true, list will contain only Bundles from Publications where current BluePrint variant of an item exists. E.g. BluePrint subtree starting from items Owning Publication and down all publications where that item variant is shared. Otherwise (by default), any Bundles in BluePrint with any BluePrint variant of an item will be returned.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether local copies of bundles containing referenced item should be included into result list.
member.value: The default value is false. When the property SuppressLocalCopies is set to true, list will contain only one instance of each bundle from the Publication where bundle was created. Otherwise (by default), local items and local copies of containing bundles will be included.

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.UserWorkItemsFilterData
member.summary: Represents the data of a Filter for a list of Work Items for current user.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.UserWorkItemsFilterData.ActivityState
member.summary: Gets or sets the condition that will constrain Work Items to those that are in Activity State being set.
member.value: A value from the enumeration or null if the condition is not specified.
member.remarks: When specified, the results are constrained to Activity Instances either assigned to or performed by the current user. If set to then returns Work Items assigned to current user. If set to then returns Work Items that are in-progress by the current user. If set to then returns Work Items suspended during execution and the current user is the last performer of those Work Items. If set to then returns failed Work Items that were performed by the current user. If set to then returns Work Items that are finished by the current user or were assigned to current user. If set to then returns Work Items waiting for execution by Workflow Agent.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.UserWorkItemsFilterData.ContextRepository
member.summary: Gets or sets a condition on the owning Repository.
member.value: A link to the owning Repository or null if the condition is not specified.
member.remarks: When specified, the results are constraint by the specified value, so only items in that Repository will be included in the result.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.UserWorkItemsFilterData.Subject
member.summary: Gets or sets a condition on the Workflow Item.
member.value: The TCM URIs of the workflow item or null if the condition is not specified.
member.remarks: When specified, the result will include only Work Items representing specific workflow item.

member.summary: Represents the data of a Filter for a list of Process Definition Associations.
member.remarks: An unfiltered list can only be obtained by users with System Administration privileges. If the list is filtered on Context Repository, it can also be obtained by users that have Workflow Management rights on that Repository.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ProcessDefinitionAssociationsFilterData.ContextRepository
member.summary: Gets or sets a condition on the Context Repository; only associations that exist in this Repository will be returned.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ProcessDefinitionAssociationsFilterData.ProcessDefinition

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ProcessesFilterData
member.summary: Represents the data of a Filter for a list of Processes.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ProcessesFilterData.ForPerformer
member.summary: Gets or sets the condition to constrain the items returned by the list to this value.
member.value: The value constrains the items returned by the list to only processes which are assigned to the specified user.

remarks.para: For a System Administrator, this property allows to filter results based on a specific performer or return unfiltered results. For a user with Workflow Management Rights in one or more Publications - only the Processes from those Publications are returned, filtered based on a specific performer being set. For a user that is not a System Administrator and does not have Workflow Management Rights in any Publication, this property can be set only to that user.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ProcessesFilterData.ForProcessDefinition
member.summary: Gets or sets the condition to constrain the items returned by the list to this value.
member.value: The value constrains the items returned by the list to only processes with the specified Process Definition.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ProcessesFilterData.ForRepository
member.summary: Gets or sets the condition to constrain the items returned by the list to this value.
member.value: The value constrains the items returned by the list to only processes from the specified Repository.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ProcessesFilterData.ProcessType
member.summary: Gets or sets the condition to constrain the items returned by the list to this value. Using this condition it is possible to return only Process Instance objects, only Process History objects, or both, which is the default.
member.value: The value constrains the items returned by the list to only processes of the specified type.

remarks.para:
ProcessType currently can affect how results are filtered based on security when the calling user is not a System Administrator and does not have Workflow Management Rights in any Publication:
When the calling user is a System Administrator, no security filtering is applied.
When the calling user has Workflow Management Rights in one or more Publications, only the Processes that belong to those Publications are returned.
When the calling user doesn't have Workflow Management Rights in any Publication, only the Processes that assigned to that user will be returned.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ProcessesFilterData.ForSubject
member.summary: Gets or sets condition to constrain the items returned by the list to this subject.
member.value: The value constrains the items returned by the list to only processes based on this subject.
member.remarks:
Any version in subject will be ignored. If any version of the item is in any Process Instance/History it will be included in the result. The subject context publication is ignored, any processes (depending on other filter criteria) having shared/localized version of the subject are returned. The might not contain this subject, as the returns the work items from the last (active) activity.
This property is introduced in version 7.0

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ProcessesFilterData.IncludeWorkflowTypeColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether information about Workflow Type (Workflow Type Id and Title) should be included into result list.
member.value: The default value is false. When the property IncludeWorkflowTypeColumns is set to true, list will contain Workflow Type Id and Title.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ProcessesFilterData.LegacyMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether returned list in the new format (supporting multi-item workflows) or in the legacy format (single-item workflow).
member.value: If set to true returns list in the new format (supporting multi-item workflows). If set to false returns list in the legacy format (single-item workflow).
member.remarks: If set to true Processes without any Subject will not be returned. Legacy format list does not support Multi-Item Workflow or Workflow without any subject.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ProcessesFilterData.WorkflowType
member.summary: Gets or sets the condition to constrain the items returned by the list to specific Workflow Type. Using this condition it is possible to return only Process objects of specific type (such as Task). Filter is not applied by default.
member.value: The value constrains the items returned by the list to only processes of the specified workflow type.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ProcessesFilterData.IncludeSubjectsColumn
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether subjects should be included into result list.
member.value: The default value is false. When the property IncludeSubjectsColumn is set to true, list will contain list.
member.remarks: This property is introduced in version 7.1

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ActivityInstancesFilterData
member.summary: Represents the data of a Filter for a list of Activity Instances.
member.remarks:
The following properties/attribute will be loaded/set on the data object list or Xml List depending on and other filters:
Id
Title
ContextRepository
Process
ActivityDefinition
Assignee
Owner
StartDate
ActivityState
CreationDate
SuspendDate
FinishDate
AllowedActions
WorkItem.Id
WorkItem.Subject
WorkItem.Owner
WorkItem.SubjectOwningRepository

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ActivityInstancesFilterData.ActivityState
member.summary: Gets or sets the Activity State to filter on. Multiple Activity State can be combined.
member.remarks: Limits the returned result to .

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ActivityInstancesFilterData.ContextRepository
member.summary: Gets or sets the Context Repository to filter on.
member.remarks: Limits the returned result to specified Context Repository.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ActivityInstancesFilterData.ForAllUsers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to return Activity Instances for Current User or All User
member.remarks:
When the ForAllUsers filter property is set to false (the default value), the results will be filtered on Assignee or Owner depending on the activity instance state: Activity Instance(s) in Assigned State are returned if they are assigned to the Current User or any groups of the Current User. Activity Instances in other Activity State(s) are returned if they are owned by the Current User
When the ForAllUsers filter property is set to true, the results are filtered by security instead. Only the Activity Instances on which the current user has Workflow Management rights (or system administration privileges) are returned.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ActivityInstancesFilterData.IncludeAdditionalDateColumns

member.value: The default value is false.
member.remarks: When the property IncludeAdditionalDateColumns is set to true, lists to which this filter is applied will return the SuspendDate, FinishDate and DueDate of the Activity Instances.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ActivityInstancesFilterData.IncludeWorkItems

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ActivityInstancesFilterData.WorkflowType
