member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.WorkflowTypesFilterData
member.summary: A Filter that can be used to constrain a list of configured Workflow Types.

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.RepositoryLocalObjectsFilterData
member.summary: Represents the data of a filter that can be used for a list of repository-local objects (e.g. get items for the given set of item ids, all checked-out items).
member.remarks:
As per current implementation if is set then it returns those items constrained by the filter. Otherwise it returns items that are checked out, either by the current user if is not set, or by the user specified in condition, constrained by the rest of the filter condition.
There is a legacy issue related to the fact that SchemaPurpose, ComponentType and TemplateType conditions map together to the same, one legacy filter condition called SubType. Use these 3 conditions separately from each other so do not restrict by SchemaPurposes, ComponentTypes and TemplateTypeIds conditions together. Also always restrict by ItemType in additon to each of these conditions. Otherwise, the results can contain unexpected items types. When setting the SchemaPurposes condition, also set the ItemTypes to . When setting the ComponentTypes condition, also set the ItemTypes to . When setting the TemplateTypeIds condition, also set the ItemTypes to one or more templates (for example and ).
If the condition is set and the requested items are in workflow, the allowed actions of the associated activity instance will also be returned (allowed to start, finish, suspend and restart).

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.RepositoryLocalObjectsFilterData.ComponentTypes
member.summary: Gets or sets a condition on the ComponentTypes.
member.value: A collection of component type values or null if the condition is not specified.
member.remarks: Setting this value sets the to null. When setting this condition, do not set SchemaPurposes and TemplateTypeIds conditions. Also always restrict by ItemType in additon: set the ItemTypes to . Otherwise, the results can contain unexpected items types.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.RepositoryLocalObjectsFilterData.IncludeLockUserColumn
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the property or XML attributes CheckOutUser and Trustee are set in the returned list.
member.value: The default value is false.
member.remarks: This property does not have any effect when ItemIds condition is set.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.RepositoryLocalObjectsFilterData.IncludeRelativeWebDavUrlColumn
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the property or XML attribute URL is set in the returned list
member.value: The default value is false.
member.remarks: When the property IncludeRelativeWebDavUrlColumn is set to true, lists to which this filter is applied will return the WebDAV URL relative to its container.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.RepositoryLocalObjectsFilterData.ItemTypes
member.summary: Gets or sets the item types to filter on.

value.para: A set of values from the enumeration or null if no filtering on item type should occur.
Do not combine values using a bitwise or operator, use multiple separate values instead.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.RepositoryLocalObjectsFilterData.LockFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets a bitmask to apply to the versioned items' . Must be used in combination with .
member.value: Value or combination of values from or null if the condition is not specified.
member.remarks: VersionedItems can have a combination of for example InWorkflow and CheckedOut. The will do a bit mask on the of the and will compare the result with the . This property does not filter out organizational items which also can be locked.
member.example: To search for all CheckedOut items that are not in Workflow set the to CheckedOut and InWorkflow and the to CheckedOut.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.RepositoryLocalObjectsFilterData.LockResult
member.summary: Gets or sets a value specifying if versioned items with the given should be returned.
member.value: Value or combination of values from or null if the condition is not specified.
member.remarks: VersionedItems can have a combination of for example InWorkflow and CheckedOut. The will do a bitmask on the of the and will compare the result with the property. This property does not filter out organizational items which also can be locked.
member.example: To search for all CheckedOut items that are not in Workflow set the to CheckedOut and InWorkflow and the to CheckedOut.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.RepositoryLocalObjectsFilterData.LockUser
member.summary: Gets or sets a condition on the User who checked-out the versioned item.
member.value: A link to a User object to select all items checked-out by this user, if specified. If not specified or NullLink is used, current session's user will be used to determine accessibility to an item.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.RepositoryLocalObjectsFilterData.SchemaPurposes
member.summary: Gets or sets a condition on the SchemaPurposes.
member.value: A collection of schema purpose values or null if the condition is not specified.
member.remarks: When setting this condition, do not set ComponentTypes and TemplateTypeIds conditions. Also always restrict by ItemType in additon: set the ItemTypes to . Otherwise, the results can contain unexpected items types.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.RepositoryLocalObjectsFilterData.TemplateTypeIds
member.summary: Gets or sets the condition to limit the list to items with given template type IDs.
member.value: A collection of template types IDs or null if the condition is not specified.
member.remarks: Setting this value sets the to null. When setting this condition, do not set SchemaPurposes and ComponentTypes conditions together. Also always restrict by ItemType in additon: set the ItemTypes to one or more templates (for example and ). Otherwise, the results can contain unexpected items types.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.RepositoryLocalObjectsFilterData.BasedOnSchemas
member.summary: Gets or sets a condition to return only items that are using the given schemas.

remarks.para: If the list of schemas is null, the condition is not applied. This condition should be used in conjunction with . Setting the condition to an empty list of schemas will return an empty list.
This property does not have any effect when ItemIds condition is not set.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.RepositoryLocalObjectsFilterData.IncludeLocationInfoColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Location Info columns is included in the returned list.
member.value: The default value is false.
member.remarks: This property is only valid in combination with property. This property determines the inclusion of the or the following XML attribute OrgItemId, OrgItemTitle, Path and URL while getting the XML list. Supported CoreService Endpoint : CoreService 2011

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.RepositoryLocalObjectsFilterData.ItemIds
member.summary: Gets or sets the condition to limit the result to given IDs.
member.value: A collection of TcmUri and/or WebDavUrls or null if the condition is not specified.

remarks.para: If the specified TcmUri are versionless, the result will contain the latest versions of the requested items. It is possible to request specific versions of items (even multiple versions of the same item), if the TcmUri contains version part. To get currently checked-out/locked version, the version 0 must be explicitly requested.
Supported CoreService Endpoint : CoreService 2011

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.RepositoryLocalObjectsFilterData.UseDynamicVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to include dynamic version of an item if accessible.
member.value: A boolean value to indicate whether to use latest dynamic version or not.
member.remarks:
This property is used to enable the user to see the dynamic version (v0) of an item provided some conditions are satisfied.
When UseDynamicVersion is set to True and item is checked-out, the result will contain dynamic version if user has rights to read this version (for example, this item is checked-out by this user, or assigned to user, or user is a member of the System Administration group or AllowReadDynamicContent option is set to True in security configuration).
This option is only applied to versionless in list.
Default value is false.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.RepositoryLocalObjectsFilterData.IncludeDescriptionColumn
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to include the item's description in the list.
member.value: true to include the Description column; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: This property is introduced in version 7.0
This property does not have any effect when ItemIds condition is not set.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.RepositoryLocalObjectsFilterData.IncludeDynamicVersionInfoColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to include dynamic version info of the item in the list.
member.value: true to include the dynamic version info; otherwise, false.
member.remarks:
This property is introduced in version 7.0.
This property determines the pre-loading of the dynamic version properties or the following XML attributes DynamicVersionRevisorID, DynamicVersionRevisorTitle, DynamicVersionRevisorDescription, DynamicVersionRevision and DynamicVersionRevisionDate while getting the XML list.

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.BluePrintParentsFilterData

member.remarks: The BluePrint parents list will always contain only those parent repositories where the user has publication management rights.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.BluePrintParentsFilterData.CurrentParents
member.summary: Gets or sets the condition to skip specific parents in the result.

member.remarks: The returned list will contain Publications which are possible to be used as new parents for existing Publication. Publications from outside of the current BluePrint tree and current parent Publications will be flitered out. To get a list of valid BluePrint parent Publications for a new Publication, set this value to null.

member.summary: Gets or sets the assignee (override) for the next Activity.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ActivityFinishData.NextActivityTitle
member.summary: Gets or sets the title to be used for the next Activity Instance.

remarks.para: By default, Activity Instances get an auto-generated title consisting of their position and the title of their Activity Definition. However, it is also possible to let Activity Instance have a custom title. Such a custom title can be specified when finishing the previous Activity using this property.
Note that this property is not used to specify what the next Activity should be in case of a decision Activity. For that purpose, should be used.
This property is introduced in version 7.0.

member.summary: Gets or sets which Activity Definition should be used for the next Activity.
member.remarks: The Activity Definition for a decision Activity specifies multiple candidate next Activities. When an decision Activity is finished, the user must select the appropriate Activity Definition (i.e. make the decision).

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ApplicationData.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the binary data.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ApplicationData.ManagedLinks
member.summary: Gets or sets managed links (reserved for future use).
member.remarks: The property is simply binary data of which the CM Kernel doesn't have any knowledge. Hence, the CM Kernel cannot automatically provide link management functionality on links to TCM items contained in some way in the data. Link management will be provided in future versions of the CM Kernel by means of this property. This property is currently exposed merely to prevent a change to the data contract in the future when link management is provided.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ApplicationData.TypeId
member.summary: Gets or sets the type identifier which can be used to deserialize the binary into a structured data type.
member.remarks: The type identifier can be any string. It doesn't have meaning to the Content Manager system; it's merely intended to help applications store and retrieve application-specific data using structured types.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ApplicationData.IsInherited
member.summary: Gets the status informing whether this application data is inherited from parent item.
member.remarks: The value of this property will be false for attached to all Non Repository Local Objects and Global Application Data. Supported CoreService Endpoint : CoreService 2011

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ApplicationData.OwningRepositoryId
member.summary: Gets the Id of the repository which owns this application data.
member.remarks:
The owning publication of an application data is either the context publication in which it is being read, or the owning publication of the subject item to which it is attached.
The value of this property will be tcm:0-0-0 for attached to all Non Repository Local Objects and Global Application Data. Supported CoreService Endpoint : CoreService 2011

member.summary: Gets the Permissions of an Identifiable object for a trustee.

For root Organizational Items the value of the is always . Use the to check if the user can read, write, localize or delete the item. Reading the item requires Publication access. Writing, deleting, localizing and un-localizing of root Organizational items requires the following rights.
FolderPublication and Folder management
Structure GroupPublication and Structure Group management
CategoryCategory management

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ISessionAwareCoreService.ResolveBundleTypes(System.String[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Resolves the Bundle Schemas and associated Bundles for the given set of Workflow Items.
member.param: Collection of identifiers of the workflowable items to resolve bundle type (TCM URI or WebDav URL).

When set to true returned value should only contain Bundle Type and Resolved Bundle which were mapped to the given Item IDs. When set to false returns all Bundle Schemas associated with bundle process and all Bundles of those types.
member.returns: A list of Bundle Types and associate bundles and item mappings.
member.remarks: All items should belong to the same publication. If a Bundle Process is specified for a given item, then it must be added to a Bundle before it can be checked in. The Bundle has to be of an appropriate type, that is, the Bundle's Schema must be associated with a Process Definition. The specified Bundle Process results in preferred Bundle types. This method can be used to determine the preferred bundle types and bundles of these types for given set of items. If an item already added in a Bundle then that Bundle and its associated Bundle Type will be returned regardless of . If there is Business Process Type associated with the Repository, only Bundle Schemas applicable for this Business Process Type and Bundle Schemas which are not used in any Business Process Type will be returned. Otherwise, all Bundle Schemas will be returned.

member.summary: Locks the organizational item. This means that item cannot be edited by other users.
member.remarks: Organizational item can only have following lock types: None, Permanent or InWorkflow. Organizational item is versionless. It means that changes made on locked item will be visible to other users.
member.param: The identifier of the organizational item (TCM URI or WebDAV URL).
Specifies how the is read back after locking. If the parameter is null, the object is not read back.
member.returns: A object that is read back, with appropriate values according to the after it is locked, if is not null. Otherwise returns null.
member.exception: Generic service exception that encapsulates the inner exception(s). T is of type .

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ISessionAwareCoreService.StartWorkflow(System.String,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.StartWorkflowInstructionData,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Creates with first .
member.param: The identifier (TCM URI or WebDAV URL) of the repository on which workflow must be started.
Contains parameters, which will be used for starting workflow and creating first activity instance.
Specifies how the is read back after starting workflow. If the parameter is null, the object is not read back.
member.returns: Created object.

remarks.para: and first will be created with values, which specified in .

The optional and might not be specified in . In that case, if there is only one subject specified and it's a Bundle, then Process Definition associated with Bundle Metadata Schema will be used (if any). Otherwise, process will be taken.
The property doesn't affect getting process definition for shared items. Bundle Process Definition is always shared from parent.

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ISessionAwareCoreService.UndoPublishTransaction(System.String,System.Nullable{Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.QueueMessagePriority},Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Undoes the Publish Transaction.
member.param: The Id of the Publish Transaction which should be Undone.
The priority used for queuing the undo request.
Specifies how the is read back after undoing. If the parameter is null, the object is not read back.
member.returns: The Publish Transaction.

remarks.para: Undoing a Publish transaction will result in the system trying to pretend that this publish transaction did not happen. If items were overwritten by subsequent Publish Transactions then they will not be modified.

This is an asynchronous operation, and the method will return as soon as the Undo request is queued. The Publish Transaction can be read again to determine if the Undo was successful or not, by looking at the . Further details about the individual items can be found in .

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ISessionAwareCoreService.Validate(Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.IdentifiableObjectData)
member.summary: Validates the state of .
member.param: An which contains the properties to be validated.
member.returns: A list of if any.
member.remarks:
The operation is possible on a valid delta. In order to validate a saved item, a data object with only the Id property set can be passed. Any property set along with the Id property will be merged with the saved state and then validated. If the item is not saved, then defaults will be used for properties which are not set.
The operation is currently only allowed on Page. Trying to pass any other items will result in an exception.

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ISessionAwareCoreService.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Permanently deletes the item or a specific version of the item from the system.

remarks.para: The object should not be used anymore after this method has been called.

For an instance of a class that derives from , the version that is loaded into the instance is taken into account. If the latest version of the item is loaded without a version specified in the TCM URI, the item will be fully deleted. If a specific version of the item is loaded, only that version will be deleted.
If the object being deleted is a , the method offers more control over the handling of the keyword's descendants. The method is the equivalent of calling method with an argument value of .

If the object being deleted is a , then Process Instance will be deleted and workflow process will be terminated. The Process Instance won't exist anymore it will be archived to Process History. All subjects will be undone check-out after Delete operation is completed successfully.

member.param: The identifier of the item (TCM URI or WebDAV URL).
member.exception: Generic service exception that encapsulates the inner exception(s). T is of type .

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ISessionAwareCoreService.CheckOut(System.String,System.Boolean,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Checks-out the item. This means that a separate, editable version is created and a lock is placed on the item.
member.remarks: Items that support versioning must be checked-out before they can be edited. Checking-out an item locks the item so that it cannot be modified by others in the meantime. Furthermore, it creates a separate, editable version of the item that is only accessible to the user that performed the check-out. This method can be used to perform such a check-out. This methods can also be used to place a permanent lock (by means of the permanentLock parameter).
member.param: The identifier of the item (TCM URI or WebDAV URL).
Indicates whether to place a permanent lock or a temporary (edit) lock.
Specifies how the is read back after checking out. If the parameter is null, the object is not read back.
member.returns: A object that is read back, with appropriate values according to the after it is checked out, if is not null. Otherwise returns null.
member.exception: Generic service exception that encapsulates the inner exception(s). T is of type .

member.summary: Checks-in the item. This means that the editable version is turned into the new current version and the lock on the item is removed.
member.remarks: Items that support versioning must be checked-out before they can be edited. Checking-out an item locks the item so that it cannot be modified by others in the meantime. Furthermore, it creates a separate, editable version of the item that is only accessible to the user that performed the check-out. Alternatively, the method can be used.
member.param: The identifier of the item (TCM URI or WebDAV URL).
If true, any permanent lock will be removed. If false, the check-in is not performed if there is a permanent lock on the item.
Set the user comment of this item. If null the user comment is not changed.
Specifies how the is read back after checking in. If the parameter is null, the object is not read back.
member.returns: A object that is read back, with appropriate values according to the after it is checked in, if is not null. Otherwise returns null.
member.exception: Generic service exception that encapsulates the inner exception(s). T is of type .

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ISessionAwareCoreService.UndoCheckOut(System.String,System.Boolean,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Undoes a check-out. This means that the editable version is discarded and the lock on the item is removed.
member.remarks: A item that support versioning must be checked-out before it can be edited. Checking-out an item locks the item so that it cannot be modified by others in the meantime. Furthermore, it creates a separate, editable version of the item that is only accessible to the user that performed the check-out. This method can be used to undo the check-out and thus discard all changes made since the check-out. If the item was never checked-in before, this mean the item effectively gets deleted.
member.param: The identifier of the item (TCM URI or WebDAV URL).
The type of the lock to be set on the Item.
Specifies how the is read back after undoing the checkout. If the parameter is null, the object is not read back.
member.returns: A object that is read back, with appropriate values according to the after the checkout has been undone, if is not null and the object is not deleted as result of the UndoCheckOut. Otherwise returns null.
member.exception: Generic service exception that encapsulates the inner exception(s). T is of type .

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ISessionAwareCoreService.Localize(System.String,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Localizes the item in the context Publication. This means that a local copy of the item is created in the context Publication.
member.remarks:
Through Blueprinting, an item can be shared in multiple Publications. However, a shared item can only be changed in its owning Publication. In order to change the item in another (child) Publication, it must first be localized in that Publication. Localizing creates a separate version of the item in the child Publication (a so-called local copy). Note that some item types have restrictions on what can be changed on a local copy. For example, for Schemas, only the Labels (for instance Descriptions) can be changed.
By default, latest checked-in version of the versioned item is localized. However, dynamic version (the -v0) of checked-out item, item in workflow or new item can be localized if requested by user.
member.param: The identifier of the item (TCM URI or WebDAV URL).
Specifies how the is read back after localizing. If the parameter is null, the object is not read back.
member.returns: A object that is read back, with appropriate values according to the after it is localized, if is not null. Otherwise returns null.
member.exception: Generic service exception that encapsulates the inner exception(s). T is of type .

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ISessionAwareCoreService.UnLocalize(System.String,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Un-localizes the item in the context Publication. This means that the local copy is deleted and the item becomes a shared item again.
member.remarks: If there's no longer a need for a separate version of the item in a child publication, it can be un-localized. That way, it becomes a shared item again and therefore needn't be maintained separately.
member.param: The identifier of the item (TCM URI or WebDAV URL).
Specifies how the is read back after unlocalizing. If the parameter is null, the object is not read back.
member.returns: A object that is read back, with appropriate values according to the after it is un-localized, if is not null. Otherwise returns null.
member.exception: Generic service exception that encapsulates the inner exception(s). T is of type .

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ISessionAwareCoreService.Localize2(System.String,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.OperationInstruction,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Localizes the item in the context Publication. This means that a local copy of the item is created in the context Publication.
member.remarks:
Through Blueprinting, an item can be shared in multiple Publications. However, a shared item can only be changed in its owning Publication. In order to change the item in another (child) Publication, it must first be localized in that Publication. Localizing creates a separate version of the item in the child Publication (a so-called local copy). Note that some item types have restrictions on what can be changed on a local copy. For example, for Schemas, only the Labels (for instance Descriptions) can be changed.
By default, latest checked-in version of the versioned item is localized. However, dynamic version (the -v0) of checked-out item, item in workflow or new item can be localized if requested by user.
member.param: The identifier of the item (TCM URI or WebDAV URL).

param.name: instruction
param.para: Controls how operation will be executed.
In mode if any error(s) are found a Validation Exception will be thrown.
In mode if any error(s) and/or warning(s) are found a Validation Exception will be thrown.
Note that in case the Validation Exception occurred in the initialized phase, then, the processed event handlers are not executed.
If null or not specified, mode will be used.

member.param: Specifies how the is read back after localizing. If the parameter is null, the object is not read back.
member.returns:
A object that contains item with appropriate values according to the after it is localized, if is not null. Otherwise does not return an item.
Result also may contain list of warnings that were generated during execution (regardless of ).
member.exception: Generic service exception that encapsulates the inner exception(s). T is of type .

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ISessionAwareCoreService.UnLocalize2(System.String,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.OperationInstruction,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Un-localizes the item in the context Publication. This means that the local copy is deleted and the item becomes a shared item again.
member.remarks: If there's no longer a need for a separate version of the item in a child publication, it can be un-localized. That way, it becomes a shared item again and therefore needn't be maintained separately.
member.param: The identifier of the item (TCM URI or WebDAV URL).

param.name: instruction
param.para: Controls how operation will be executed.
In mode if any error(s) are found a Validation Exception will be thrown.
In mode if any error(s) and/or warning(s) are found a Validation Exception will be thrown.
Note that in case the Validation Exception occurred in the initialized phase, then, the processed event handlers are not executed.
If null or not specified, mode will be used.

member.param: Specifies how the is read back after unlocalizing. If the parameter is null, the object is not read back.
member.returns:
A object that contains item with appropriate values according to the after it is un-localized, if is not null. Otherwise does not return an item.
Result also may contain list of warnings that were generated during execution (regardless of ).
member.exception: Generic service exception that encapsulates the inner exception(s). T is of type .

member.summary: Promotes the local item to one of its parent repository in the BluePrint.
member.param: The identifier of the item (TCM URI or WebDAV URL) to be promoted.
The identifier of the parent repository (TCM URI or WebDAV URL) where item should be promoted to.

param.name: instruction
param.para: Controls how operation will be executed.
In mode if any error(s) are found a Validation Exception will be thrown.
In mode if any error(s) and/or warning(s) are found a Validation Exception will be thrown.
Note that in case the Validation Exception occurred in the initialized phase, then, the processed event handlers are not executed.
If null or not specified, mode will be used.

member.param: Specifies how the is read back after promoting. If the parameter is null, the object is not read back.
member.returns:
A object that contains item with appropriate values according to the after it is promoted, if is not null. Otherwise does not return an item.
Result also may contain list of warnings that were generated during execution (regardless of ).
member.exception:
Generic service exception that encapsulates the inner exception(s). T is of type .
In case of validation errors or warnings, specific validation errors will be available in colection, warnings will be available in colection. Multiple validation errors or warnings can be reported.
member.remarks:
Promote allows to move a repository-local object from repository where it is defined to one of its parent repositories up in the BluePrint.
Note that in order to successfully promote an item, all its dependencies must exist in the repository item will be promoted to.

Demote allows to move a repository-local object from repository where it is defined to one of the child repositories down in the BluePrint.
Note that in order to successfully demote an item, it must not be used, published or localized in any of the repositories it will be demoted from.

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ISessionAwareCoreService.Classify(System.String,System.String[],Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Classifies the item by adding the specified Keyword classification(s) (if valid according to Schema definition).
member.remarks: This function is intended to add one or more Keywords to all the Keyword fields of this item (content and/or metadata). Classification is not supported for Schema, Category, Target Group and Process Definition item types.
member.param: The identifier of the item (TCM URI or WebDAV URL).
A collection of Keyword identifiers to classify the item. The collection can not be empty and must contain valid TCM URI identifiers or WebDAV URLs.
Specifies additional read options for the returned value. The return value is null if this parameter is null.
member.returns: If was not null, a object that contains the Item that was classified and a collection of objects that contains information about all fields, where the requested keywords matched and were added. If was null, null is returned.

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ISessionAwareCoreService.UnClassify(System.String,System.String[],Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Unclassifies the item by removing the specified Keyword classification(s) (if valid according to Schema definition).
member.remarks: This function is intended to remove one or more Keywords from all the Keyword fields of this item (content and/or metadata). Classification is not supported for Schema, Category, Target Group and Process Definition item types.
member.param: The identifier of the item (TCM URI or WebDAV URL).
A collection of Keyword identifiers to unclassify (remove from) the item. The collection can not be empty and must contain valid TCM URI identifiers or WebDAV URLs.
Specifies additional read options for the returned value. The return value is null if this parameter is null.
member.returns: If was not null, a object that contains the Item that was unclassified and a collection of objects that contains information about all fields, where the requested keywords matched and were removed. If was null, null is returned.

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ISessionAwareCoreService.ReClassify(System.String,System.String[],System.String[],Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Reclassifies the item by removing the specified Keyword classification(s) and replacing them with others specified (if valid according to Schema definition).
member.remarks: This function is intended to replace one or more Keywords in all the Keyword fields of this item (content and/or metadata). Classification is not supported for Schema, Category, Target Group and Process Definition item types.
member.param: The identifier of the item (TCM URI or WebDAV URL).
A collection of Keyword identifiers to remove from the item. The collection can not be empty and must contain valid TCM URI identifiers or WebDAV URLs.
A collection of Keyword identifiers to add to the item. The collection can not be empty and must contain valid TCM URI identifiers or WebDAV URLs.
Specifies additional read options for the returned value. The return value is null if this parameter is null.
member.returns: If was not null, a object that contains the Item that was reclassified and a collection of objects that contains information about all fields, where the requested keywords matched and were replaced. If was null, null is returned.

Specifies additional read options for the returned value. The return value is null if this parameter is null.

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ISessionAwareCoreService.SuspendActivity(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.String,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Suspends a Workflow Activity Instance.
member.param: The identifier of the Activity Instance (TCM URI).
The reason of the suspending activity.
Time, when suspending activity must be resumed.
The resume bookmark for suspending activities.
Specifies additional read options for the returned value. The return value is null if this parameter is null.
member.returns: If was not null, an Activity Instance Data object that represents the suspended Activity Instance. If was null, null is returned.

remarks.para: This method can be called manually or by an automated Activity script. Workflow activity can continue execution after calling method.
The current User must be the Owner or have Workflow Management Rights.
An automated activity will be resumed automatically (if is specified).

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ISessionAwareCoreService.RestartActivity(System.String,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Restarts a Workflow Activity Instance.
member.param: The identifier of the Activity Instance (TCM URI).
Specifies additional read options for the returned value. The return value is null if this parameter is null.
member.returns: If was not null, an Activity Instance Data object that represents the restarted Activity Instance. If was null, null is returned.

remarks.para: This method can only be used for automatic Activity Instances. Activity State must be in in order to restart the activity.

The Workflow Agent sets the Activity Instance State to as soon as an error occurs in an automated Activity. (i.e. automated activity instance with script that throws exception.) A user may retry the execution of the workflow activity using the Restart method after the fixing the error.
If the Activity Instance is successfully restarted, it enters the state. The Workflow Agent will pick it up again and set the Activity Instance state to .

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ISessionAwareCoreService.ReAssignActivity(System.String,System.String,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Reassigns a Workflow Activity Instance to a new Trustee.
member.param: The identifier of the Activity Instance (TCM URI).
The identifier of the new Assignee (TCM URI).
Specifies additional read options for the returned value. The return value is null if this parameter is null.
member.returns: If was not null, an Activity Instance Data object that represents the reassigned Activity Instance. If was null, null is returned.

remarks.para: The Activity Instance must be in or state for this operation to succeed. Additionally, if the Activity State is Started, the provided Assignee can only be a User.
The User performing the operation must have Read Permissions on every subject related to this Activity Instance and Workflow Management Rights on the context repository.

If the Activity State is Started, only the Performers collection is updated in order to hold the new user. If The Activity State is Assigned, only the Assignee property is updated in order to hold the new trustee.

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ISessionAwareCoreService.FinishActivity(System.String,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ActivityFinishData,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)

member.returns: If was not null, an Activity Instance Data object that represents the next Activity Instance that was created when finishing this Activity Instance, or null when there is no next Activity Instance. If was null, null is returned.

remarks.para: All the Subjects of the related Work Items will be checked-in after a force finish.
Approval Status Id can be set null. In that case Approval Statuses of all the Subjects of the related Work Items will not be updated.

member.returns: If was not null, a corresponding Process History Data object that represents archived Process Instance. If was null, null is returned.

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ISessionAwareCoreService.PreviewItem(Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.RepositoryLocalObjectData,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.TemplateData,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.PublishInstructionData,System.String)
member.summary: Renders the preview for a given item (and template) with optionally delta data applied. That is: this method can preview non-persisted/transient changes to the item and/or template.
member.param: The delta data for the item to render. The specified delta data is merged into the persisted state of the item referred to by the property. If the Id property is tcm:0-0-0, the delta is merged into default data. In this case, the property must be set.

The delta data for the Template to render with (can be null, see remarks). The specified delta data is merged into the persisted state of the template referred to by the property. If the Id property is tcm:0-0-0, the delta is merged into default data. In this case, the property must be set.
The Publish Instruction to use in order to render the Item.
The id of the Publication Target to use. Can be null. Current implementation ignores while generating the preview.
member.returns: A object containing the rendered content.

remarks.para: can be null. In case of null , default component template of publication will be used for rendering of components and default default page template for rendering of pages. Exception will be thrown if template property is not set and values of default templates cant be obtained.

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ISessionAwareCoreService.IsPublished(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns whether the given item is published to the specified Publishing Target.
member.param: The identifier of the item (TCM URI or WebDAV URL) to get the publish state for.

param.name: publishingTargetIdOrPurpose
param.para: The TCM URI of the Target Type or Publication Target or Target Purpose of the to which the item should be published.

If URI of the Publishing Target (Target Type or Publication Target or Target Purpose) is not specified or URI is set to "tcm:0-0-0" then the published state of the item will be checked against all existing Publishing Targets and if the item is published to at least one Publishing Target then return value will be true; otherwise, false.

member.param: Indicates if state should be returned regardless of the context Publication. If true check if item is published in the context Publication only. If false check if the item is published in any Publication.
member.returns: true if the given item is published to the specified Publishing Target or any Publishing Target when none specified.

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ISessionAwareCoreService.GetWorkItemSnapshot(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the snapshot of the Activity of the given Work Item.
member.param: The identifier of the Work Item (TCM URI).
member.returns: The snapshot of the Activity of the given Work Item.
member.remarks:
Returns null if there is no snapshot stored or storing snapshot is turned off or the Work Item is not finished yet.
If the snapshot contains Binaries, the actual binary content can be downloaded by calling the method. Binaries will always be generated on a file location relative to the Content Manager temporary path. The returned objects will have an appropriate path in their property and callers of the method can use that value to retrieve the binary content as a stream.

remarks.p: The can contain null, tcm:0-0-0 or empty string to read global application data. However when returning, the global application data will always be associated with tcm:0-0-0 as key even if null was passed in .
The can be null to read all Application Data.

In case a subject does not exist or Application Data does not exist the returned dictionary will contain empty collection. However, it is recommended to ensure that being passed in all exists, as events will be fired for all passed in , some event handler might try to load the item and fail.

Keep in mind that this is a bulk retrieval method, and using this method with very small amount of might actually perform worse. Also using null for is not recommended, as it may cause significant performance impact. Ideally this method should be used with a set of and only the required .

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ISessionAwareCoreService.EnlistInTransaction
member.summary: Forces client to enlist in a pending transaction if any.
member.remarks: When a transactional Core Service method is called, WCF flows the client transaction to the server and it is stored in the Core Service's session state. When a non-transactional (read-only) Core Service method is called, WCF doesn't flow the client transaction to the server, so initially the server is unaware of the context transaction. Particularly, that is a problem in complex scenarios when client application has two or more connections to CoreService and needs to read uncommitted data that were created by one client using the other client connection. In order to overcome that problem, client that is reading uncommitted data should first enlist itself in the perding transaction using this method.

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ICoreService.ResolveBundleTypes(System.String[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Resolves the Bundle Schemas and associated Bundles for the given set of Workflow Items.
member.param: Collection of identifiers of the workflowable items to resolve bundle type (TCM URI or WebDav URL).

When set to true returned value should only contain Bundle Type and Resolved Bundle which were mapped to the given Item IDs. When set to false returns all Bundle Schemas associated with bundle process and all Bundles of those types.
member.returns: A list of Bundle Types and associate bundles and item mappings.
member.remarks: All items should belong to the same publication. If a Bundle Process is specified for a given item, then it must be added to a Bundle before it can be checked in. The Bundle has to be of an appropriate type, that is, the Bundle's Schema must be associated with a Process Definition. The specified Bundle Process results in preferred Bundle types. This method can be used to determine the preferred bundle types and bundles of these types for given set of items. If an item already added in a Bundle then that Bundle and its associated Bundle Type will be returned regardless of . If there is Business Process Type associated with the Repository, only Bundle Schemas applicable for this Business Process Type and Bundle Schemas which are not used in any Business Process Type will be returned. Otherwise, all Bundle Schemas will be returned.

member.summary: Locks the organizational item. This means that item cannot be edited by other users.

member.summary: Creates with first .
member.param: The identifier (TCM URI or WebDAV URL) of the repository on which workflow must be started.
Contains parameters, which will be used for starting workflow and creating first activity instance.
Specifies how the is read back after starting workflow. If the parameter is null, the object is not read back.
member.returns: Created object.

remarks.para: and first will be created with values, which specified in .

The optional and might not be specified in . In that case, if there is only one subject specified and it's a Bundle, then Process Definition associated with Bundle Metadata Schema will be used (if any). Otherwise, process will be taken.
The property doesn't affect getting process definition for shared items. Bundle Process Definition is always shared from parent.

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ICoreService.UndoPublishTransaction(System.String,System.Nullable{Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.QueueMessagePriority},Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Undoes the Publish Transaction.
member.param: The Id of the Publish Transaction which should be Undone.
The priority used for queuing the undo request.
Specifies how the is read back after undoing. If the parameter is null, the object is not read back.
member.returns: The Publish Transaction.

remarks.para: Undoing a Publish transaction will result in the system trying to pretend that this publish transaction did not happen. If items were overwritten by subsequent Publish Transactions then they will not be modified.

This is an asynchronous operation, and the method will return as soon as the Undo request is queued. The Publish Transaction can be read again to determine if the Undo was successful or not, by looking at the . Further details about the individual items can be found in .

member.summary: Validates the state of .
member.param: An which contains the properties to be validated.
member.returns: A list of if any.
member.remarks:
The operation is possible on a valid delta. In order to validate a saved item, a data object with only the Id property set can be passed. Any property set along with the Id property will be merged with the saved state and then validated. If the item is not saved, then defaults will be used for properties which are not set.
The operation is currently only allowed on Page. Trying to pass any other items will result in an exception.

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ICoreService.ResolveContainingPages(System.String,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ResolveContainingPagesInstructionData)
member.summary: Resolves pages that are using directly or indirectly a given component based on .
member.param: TCM URI or WebDAV URL of a component.
An instance of with set of options that configure resolving.
member.returns: Set of pages where component is directly or indirectly (via component links) used. If page is published, the associated set of publish info is also returned (one instance per publish destination).

remarks.para: User must have read permissions on component to call this method. Resolved pages might be removed from result set if user does not have read permissions on them.

Resolved pages are ordered by the number of links from page to provided component. If component is directly on the resolved pages, those pages will be listed first and then the pages that have links to components that reference provided component and so on.

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ICoreService.GetTcmUri(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.UInt32})
member.summary: Constructs a TCM URI from a specified base URI, context Repository URI and version number.
member.param: The base URI. Can be either a TCM URI or a WebDAV URL.
The TCM URI or WebDAV URL of the context Repository used to override the one in the parameter. Can be null if no context Repository override is needed.

The version number to override the one specified (if any) in the parameter. Use 0 to address the editable version (also known as "checked-out version" or "dynamic version"). Can be null if no version number override is needed.
member.returns: The constructed TCM URI.
member.remarks: Note that the other web methods already accept both a TCM URI and a WebDAV URL, so there is no need to call this method separately only to convert a WebDAV URL into a TCM URI. This method should only be used to override the context Repository and/or version number. The type might be generated as by the proxy generator.

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ICoreService.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Permanently deletes the item or a specific version of the item from the system.

remarks.para: The object should not be used anymore after this method has been called.

For an instance of a class that derives from , the version that is loaded into the instance is taken into account. If the latest version of the item is loaded without a version specified in the TCM URI, the item will be fully deleted. If a specific version of the item is loaded, only that version will be deleted.
If the object being deleted is a , the method offers more control over the handling of the keyword's descendants. The method is the equivalent of calling method with an argument value of .

If the object being deleted is a , then Process Instance will be deleted and workflow process will be terminated. The Process Instance won't exist anymore it will be archived to Process History. All subjects will be undone check-out after Delete operation is completed successfully.

member.param: The identifier of the item (TCM URI or WebDAV URL).
member.exception: Generic service exception that encapsulates the inner exception(s). T is of type .

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ICoreService.CheckOut(System.String,System.Boolean,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Checks-out the item. This means that a separate, editable version is created and a lock is placed on the item.
member.remarks: Items that support versioning must be checked-out before they can be edited. Checking-out an item locks the item so that it cannot be modified by others in the meantime. Furthermore, it creates a separate, editable version of the item that is only accessible to the user that performed the check-out. This method can be used to perform such a check-out. This methods can also be used to place a permanent lock (by means of the permanentLock parameter).
member.param: The identifier of the item (TCM URI or WebDAV URL).
Indicates whether to place a permanent lock or a temporary (edit) lock.
Specifies how the is read back after checking out. If the parameter is null, the object is not read back.
member.returns: A object that is read back, with appropriate values according to the after it is checked out, if is not null. Otherwise returns null.
member.exception: Generic service exception that encapsulates the inner exception(s). T is of type .

member.summary: Checks-in the item. This means that the editable version is turned into the new current version and the lock on the item is removed.
member.remarks: Items that support versioning must be checked-out before they can be edited. Checking-out an item locks the item so that it cannot be modified by others in the meantime. Furthermore, it creates a separate, editable version of the item that is only accessible to the user that performed the check-out. Alternatively, the method can be used.
member.param: The identifier of the item (TCM URI or WebDAV URL).
If true, any permanent lock will be removed. If false, the check-in is not performed if there is a permanent lock on the item.
Set the user comment of this item. If null the user comment is not changed.
Specifies how the is read back after checking in. If the parameter is null, the object is not read back.
member.returns: A object that is read back, with appropriate values according to the after it is checked in, if is not null. Otherwise returns null.
member.exception: Generic service exception that encapsulates the inner exception(s). T is of type .

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ICoreService.UndoCheckOut(System.String,System.Boolean,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Undoes a check-out. This means that the editable version is discarded and the lock on the item is removed.
member.remarks: A item that support versioning must be checked-out before it can be edited. Checking-out an item locks the item so that it cannot be modified by others in the meantime. Furthermore, it creates a separate, editable version of the item that is only accessible to the user that performed the check-out. This method can be used to undo the check-out and thus discard all changes made since the check-out. If the item was never checked-in before, this mean the item effectively gets deleted.
member.param: The identifier of the item (TCM URI or WebDAV URL).
The type of the lock to be set on the Item.
Specifies how the is read back after undoing the checkout. If the parameter is null, the object is not read back.
member.returns: A object that is read back, with appropriate values according to the after the checkout has been undone, if is not null and the object is not deleted as result of the UndoCheckOut. Otherwise returns null.
member.exception: Generic service exception that encapsulates the inner exception(s). T is of type .

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ICoreService.Localize(System.String,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Localizes the item in the context Publication. This means that a local copy of the item is created in the context Publication.
member.remarks:
Through Blueprinting, an item can be shared in multiple Publications. However, a shared item can only be changed in its owning Publication. In order to change the item in another (child) Publication, it must first be localized in that Publication. Localizing creates a separate version of the item in the child Publication (a so-called local copy). Note that some item types have restrictions on what can be changed on a local copy. For example, for Schemas, only the Labels (for instance Descriptions) can be changed.
By default, latest checked-in version of the versioned item is localized. However, dynamic version (the -v0) of checked-out item, item in workflow or new item can be localized if requested by user.
member.param: The identifier of the item (TCM URI or WebDAV URL).
Specifies how the is read back after localizing. If the parameter is null, the object is not read back.
member.returns: A object that is read back, with appropriate values according to the after it is localized, if is not null. Otherwise returns null.
member.exception: Generic service exception that encapsulates the inner exception(s). T is of type .

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ICoreService.UnLocalize(System.String,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Un-localizes the item in the context Publication. This means that the local copy is deleted and the item becomes a shared item again.
member.remarks: If there's no longer a need for a separate version of the item in a child publication, it can be un-localized. That way, it becomes a shared item again and therefore needn't be maintained separately.
member.param: The identifier of the item (TCM URI or WebDAV URL).
Specifies how the is read back after unlocalizing. If the parameter is null, the object is not read back.
member.returns: A object that is read back, with appropriate values according to the after it is un-localized, if is not null. Otherwise returns null.
member.exception: Generic service exception that encapsulates the inner exception(s). T is of type .

member.returns: If was not null, a object that contains the Item that was classified and a collection of objects that contains information about all fields, where the requested keywords matched and were added. If was null, null is returned.

member.summary: Unclassifies the item by removing the specified Keyword classification(s) (if valid according to Schema definition).
member.remarks: This function is intended to remove one or more Keywords from all the Keyword fields of this item (content and/or metadata). Classification is not supported for Schema, Category, Target Group and Process Definition item types.
member.param: The identifier of the item (TCM URI or WebDAV URL).
A collection of Keyword identifiers to unclassify (remove from) the item. The collection can not be empty and must contain valid TCM URI identifiers or WebDAV URLs.
Specifies additional read options for the returned value. The return value is null if this parameter is null.
member.returns: If was not null, a object that contains the Item that was unclassified and a collection of objects that contains information about all fields, where the requested keywords matched and were removed. If was null, null is returned.

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ICoreService.ReClassify(System.String,System.String[],System.String[],Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Reclassifies the item by removing the specified Keyword classification(s) and replacing them with others specified (if valid according to Schema definition).
member.remarks: This function is intended to replace one or more Keywords in all the Keyword fields of this item (content and/or metadata). Classification is not supported for Schema, Category, Target Group and Process Definition item types.
member.param: The identifier of the item (TCM URI or WebDAV URL).
A collection of Keyword identifiers to remove from the item. The collection can not be empty and must contain valid TCM URI identifiers or WebDAV URLs.
A collection of Keyword identifiers to add to the item. The collection can not be empty and must contain valid TCM URI identifiers or WebDAV URLs.
Specifies additional read options for the returned value. The return value is null if this parameter is null.
member.returns: If was not null, a object that contains the Item that was reclassified and a collection of objects that contains information about all fields, where the requested keywords matched and were replaced. If was null, null is returned.

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ICoreService.StartActivity(System.String,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Starts a Workflow Activity Instance.
member.param: The identifier of the Activity Instance (TCM URI).
Specifies additional read options for the returned value. The return value is null if this parameter is null.
member.returns: If was not null, an Activity Instance Data object that represents the started Activity Instance. If was null, null is returned.

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ICoreService.SuspendActivity(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.String,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Suspends a Workflow Activity Instance.
member.param: The identifier of the Activity Instance (TCM URI).
The reason of the suspending activity.
Time, when suspending activity must be resumed.
The resume bookmark for suspending activities.
Specifies additional read options for the returned value. The return value is null if this parameter is null.
member.returns: If was not null, an Activity Instance Data object that represents the suspended Activity Instance. If was null, null is returned.

remarks.para: This method can be called manually or by an automated Activity script. Workflow activity can continue execution after calling method.
The current User must be the Owner or have Workflow Management Rights.
An automated activity will be resumed automatically (if is specified).

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ICoreService.RestartActivity(System.String,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Restarts a Workflow Activity Instance.
member.param: The identifier of the Activity Instance (TCM URI).
Specifies additional read options for the returned value. The return value is null if this parameter is null.
member.returns: If was not null, an Activity Instance Data object that represents the restarted Activity Instance. If was null, null is returned.

remarks.para: This method can only be used for automatic Activity Instances. Activity State must be in in order to restart the activity.

The Workflow Agent sets the Activity Instance State to as soon as an error occurs in an automated Activity. (i.e. automated activity instance with script that throws exception.) A user may retry the execution of the workflow activity using the Restart method after the fixing the error.
If the Activity Instance is successfully restarted, it enters the state. The Workflow Agent will pick it up again and set the Activity Instance state to .

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ICoreService.ReAssignActivity(System.String,System.String,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Reassigns a Workflow Activity Instance to a new Trustee.
member.param: The identifier of the Activity Instance (TCM URI).
The identifier of the new Assignee (TCM URI).
Specifies additional read options for the returned value. The return value is null if this parameter is null.
member.returns: If was not null, an Activity Instance Data object that represents the reassigned Activity Instance. If was null, null is returned.

remarks.para: The Activity Instance must be in or state for this operation to succeed. Additionally, if the Activity State is Started, the provided Assignee can only be a User.
The User performing the operation must have Read Permissions on every subject related to this Activity Instance and Workflow Management Rights on the context repository.

If the Activity State is Started, only the Performers collection is updated in order to hold the new user. If The Activity State is Assigned, only the Assignee property is updated in order to hold the new trustee.

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ICoreService.FinishActivity(System.String,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ActivityFinishData,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Finishes a Workflow Activity Instance.
member.param: The identifier of the Activity Instance (TCM URI).
The data object that specifies some parameters for the Finish operation. Should be a when finishing a decision Activity Instance.
Specifies additional read options for the returned value. The return value is null if this parameter is null.
member.returns: If was not null, an Activity Instance Data object that represents the next Activity Instance that was created when finishing this Activity Instance, or null when there is no next Activity Instance. If was null, null is returned.

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ICoreService.ForceFinishProcess(System.String,System.String,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)
member.summary: Forces finish of a Workflow Process Instance.
member.param: The identifier of the Process Instance (TCM URI).
The identifier of the Approval Status (TCM URI) which will be set to all Subjects of the related Work Items.
Specifies additional read options for the returned value. The return value is null if this parameter is null.

remarks.para: All the Subjects of the related Work Items will be checked-in after a force finish.
Approval Status Id can be set null. In that case Approval Statuses of all the Subjects of the related Work Items will not be updated.

member.returns: If was not null, a corresponding Process History Data object that represents archived Process Instance. If was null, null is returned.

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ICoreService.ResumeActivity(System.String,Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ReadOptions)

Specifies additional read options for the returned value. The return value is null if this parameter is null.
member.returns: If was not null, an Activity Instance Data object that represents the resumed Activity Instance. If was null, null is returned.

remarks.para: The Activity Instance must be in state for this operation to succeed.
Operation can be performed by WFAgent, or activity owner, or by user with workflow management rights.

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.ICoreService.IsPublished(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns whether the given item is published to the specified Publishing Target.
member.param: The identifier of the item (TCM URI or WebDAV URL) to get the publish state for.

param.name: publishingTargetIdOrPurpose
param.para: The TCM URI of the Target Type or Publication Target or Target Purpose of the to which the item should be published.

If URI of the Publishing Target (Target Type or Publication Target or Target Purpose) is not specified or URI is set to "tcm:0-0-0" then the published state of the item will be checked against all existing Publishing Targets and if the item is published to at least one Publishing Target then return value will be true; otherwise, false.

member.param: Indicates if state should be returned regardless of the context Publication. If true check if item is published in the context Publication only. If false check if the item is published in any Publication.
member.returns: true if the given item is published to the specified Publishing Target or any Publishing Target when none specified.
